programme.title: Motorstories
programme.desc: His bike trips through California are a source of inspiration for Ola Stenegard, Chief Designer at BMW Motorrad. He meets with world-famous legends from the motorcycle industry like designer Roland Sands or customizers Michael Woolaway and Alan Stulberg.

programme.title: Ken Block - Gymkhana Grid
programme.desc: Spectacular drifts are to be expected when Ken Block visits the Gymkhana Grid.

programme.title: Cadillac Escalade
programme.desc: The Cadillac Escalade at first seems like a typical rather beefy American car, but this luxurious SUV is more of a lovable, gentle giant, that should be able to gain sympathy with its clientele.

programme.title: Ford GT40
programme.desc: With their V8 cars, Ford showed that they were able to build race winners. The Ford GT40 was a prime example for that, especially in Le Mans.

programme.title: Supercars
programme.desc: We took the Mercedes AMG SLS GT to an airfield and the Porsche 911 Turbo S to the racetrack in order to see these sporty driving machines in action and test their performance. In addition: the Audi R8 4.0 TFSI's innovative lighting technology.

programme.title: Supercars
programme.desc: Jaguar found their way back to the world of sports cars. The F-Type doesn't just look good, it's got what it takes, and the car is able to take on the competition like the BMW Z4. We also took a closer look at two other competitors, the Porsche Boxster S and Nissan's 370 Z.

programme.title: Supercars
programme.desc: For more than 60 years the Corvette has been the embodiment of the American sports car. Also: the Ford Mustang GT, an iconic model with a V8 engine at the price of a Volkswagen Passat. And: the Chevrolet Camaro, another classic from the land where cylinder capacity is still valued a lot.

programme.title: Lamborghini Huracan by O.CT
programme.desc: A lot of power thanks to a compressor. This optimized O.CT Lamborghini Huracán delivers over 800 horse power to get the blood flowing.

programme.title: Morgan ARP4
programme.desc: Since 1950, the exhilarating Morgan +4 has been the mainstay of Morgan production. The ARP4 is the latest addition to the +4 family and strictly limited to a run of 50.

programme.title: Beradino
programme.desc: A „bella macchina“, a beautiful car - but not designed by masters like Bertone or Pininfarina. Johannes Paulussen from Neuss in Germany built the Beradino by hand.

programme.title: Stunt Heroes
programme.desc: A vehicle jumps at full speed over four cars, which explode one after the other. It’s a matter of precision and timing for the Stunt Heroes. Also, up-and-coming stuntwoman Tina has to prove her skills.

programme.title: Stunt Heroes
programme.desc: The team is shooting a car rollover. Stunt coordinator Carl wants to go all out. He adds an exciting shootout to the mix. Also, he has a surprise for his boss. During the rollover he wants him to sit in the passenger seat, for the very first time.

programme.title: Stunt Heroes
programme.desc: The Stunt Heroes reveal how spectacular car stunts with big explosions are prepared and which tricks are pulled when you have to blow up a car or jump from a high-rise building.

programme.title: Bayer K 67
programme.desc: Modern materials and new production methods and a progressive look. In 1967, the Bayer K 67 concept car seemed to come directly from the future. It gave an outlook on the possible future production of series automobiles.

programme.title: Peugeot 205 Turbo 16
programme.desc: Peugeot released this classic, all wheel drive monster for one purpose only: It should bring the World Rally Championship to France. The Peugeot 205 Turbo 16 shook up the rally world in the 80s.

programme.title: Dreamcars
programme.desc: British limousines are the embodiment of luxury, they are the automotive upper class. Built with the most exclusive materials, these limousines like the Rolls Royce Phantom, Bentley Mulsanne or Jaguar XJ combine luxury, comfort and power.

programme.title: Dreamcars
programme.desc: Whether it is the Mercedes S-Class, the BMW 7-series or the Audi A8, limousines "Made in Germany" are considered status symbols, setting standards when it comes to comfort, pioneering technologies and safety.

programme.title: Dreamcars
programme.desc: International limousines by Rolls Royce, Bentley, Mercedes, BMW and Jaguar guarantee an exclusive appearance and stand for status, prestige and perfection. They are the benchmark when it comes to luxury and comfort.

programme.title: Dreamcars
programme.desc: Power limousines like the BMW M5, Mercedes-AMG E63, Audi RS6 and Mulsanne Speed offer a unique mix of style, performance and suitability for daily use. They combine the luxury of a limousine with the dynamics of a super sports car.

programme.title: Dreamcars
programme.desc: They are masterpieces of automotive art, cars of breathtaking elegance, extraordinary performance, built for speeds beyond imagination: Bugatti Chiron, Lykan Hypersports, Pagani Huayra and Ferrari LaFerrari.

programme.title: BMW Kelleners Sport 640i Grand Coupe
programme.desc: The Kelleners Sport 640i is based on one of the most beautiful 4-door coupes. The tuning company of Ralf Kelleners, the son of a three-time European touring car champion, made a name for itself by specializing in remodeling BMWs.

programme.title: Volkswagen Touareg V6 TDI
programme.desc: Volkswagen subjected the Touareg to a radical makeover. After the end of the Phaeton, it's the new luxury top model from VW. Hopes are high: it has to sell big so that management can restore the peoples' confidence in the Volkswagen brand.

programme.title: Streetwise
programme.desc: The first Grand Cherokee manufactured under the reign of Fiat is up for our test. The fourth generation of this classic looks much more elegant than before. Also: Opel's first electric family limousine, the Ampera. And: the Ssangyong Korrando.

programme.title: Streetwise
programme.desc: The new BMW One M Coupe from former race car driver Ralf Kelleners: the KS1 RS. Also: Toyota present their TS 030 hybrid at the 24-hours race of Le Mans. And: Subaru's XV crossover stands out from the company's model range.

programme.title: Streetwise
programme.desc: The 'little' Mercedes-Benz S250 with a four-cylinder engine needs so little fuel that one could call this car a piggybank. Also: the power packages Nissan 370 Z and Wiesmann GT MF5. And: the ADAC Eco Test.

programme.title: Streetwise
programme.desc: The new Porsche Boxter, a real open-top sports car. Also: Volkswagen presents the new Passat Alltrack, a real allrounder. And: Fiat's successful Panda model in its third generation version.

programme.title: Streetwise
programme.desc: Alfa Romeo present their Giulietta 2.0 model with new engines, a new TCR transmission and a minor facelift. Also: Mazda aim for compact SUV gold with the CX-5. And: the Mercedes-Benz E 300 BlueTEC Hybrid.

programme.title: Facel Vega Facellia
programme.desc: In the late 1950s, the Facel Vega Facellia was designed to compete with Porsche and Alfa Romeo and open a new market segment for the fledgling French luxury car company.

programme.title: Maserati Quattroporte GTS
programme.desc: 1963, over 50 years ago, with the Quattroporte Maserati invented a new vehicle category, the sports sedan. This GTS model is already the 6th generation of this iconic car.

programme.title: Porsche Cayenne E-Hybrid
programme.desc: Porsche presented the latest version of its luxury SUV Cayenne in southern France. The E-Hybrid combines the best of two worlds: it's very agile but can also drive short distances purely electrically.

programme.title: Belgian Rally Championship
programme.desc: The 2024 Belgian Rally Championship starts with the Rally van Haspengouw in Landen.

programme.title: Belgian Rally Championship
programme.desc: Round 2 of the 2024 Belgian Rally Championship, the Rally des Ardennes, takes place in Dinant.

programme.title: Belgian Rally Championship
programme.desc: Tielt is the location of round 3 of the 2024 Belgian Rally Championship, the TAC Rally.

programme.title: Belgian Rally Championship
programme.desc: Round 4 of the 2024 Belgian Rally Championship, the 41st Rallye de Wallonie, will go down in history as one of the most hotly contested ever.

programme.title: Belgian Rally Championship
programme.desc: Round 5 of the 2024 Belgian Rally Championship, the 47th edition of the Sezoensrally, traditionally took place on the third Saturday of May.

programme.title: Audi R8 V10 plus
programme.desc: The second generation of the Audi R8. V10 naturally aspirated engine, up to 610 horsepower and 330 kilometers an hour. A supercar with a lot of character.

programme.title: Bentley Bentayga
programme.desc: With the Bentley Bentayga, the traditional British brand is entering the fastest growing market segment. This world's first luxury SUV is a conglomerate of superlatives on wheels.

programme.title: Dreamcars
programme.desc: Italian super sports cars like the Ferrari La Ferrari, the Lamborghini Aventador or the Pagani Huayra are the most beautiful and fastest cars in the world, created by the best designers. Italian super sports cars are dreams made reality.

programme.title: Dreamcars
programme.desc: British super sports cars like the Aston Martin Vanquish, the Bentley Continental GT Speed or McLaren's P1 are among the most spectacular and beautiful sports cars in the world. It's not just about power but also grace and style.

programme.title: Dreamcars
programme.desc: Whether it is the Porsche 918 Spyder, the Audi R8, the Mercedes AMG GT or the BMW i8 - German super sports cars are the fastest and most coveted in the world, with their breathtaking top speeds and incredible engine power.

programme.title: Dreamcars
programme.desc: The super sports cars by Ferrari, Lamborghini, McLaren, Pagani and Porsche are like Formula One racing cars for the streets, the fastest and most exciting cars in the world, whose power and performance seem to defy the laws of physics.

programme.title: Dreamcars
programme.desc: Ferrari 250 GTO, Porsche 911, Aston Martin DB 5 or Lamborghini Aventador and Ferrari LaFerrari - every era produces fabulous dream cars, born from the fascination for breathtaking design and the dream for outstanding speed.

programme.title: Porsche Cayman GT4
programme.desc: The Porsche Cayman GT4. Lighter, more powerful and faster than ever. Porsche shows what is possible with this vehicle, when fast lap times are in the focus of attention.

programme.title: Porsche Techart Grand GT
programme.desc: The Techart Grand GT may look like Darth Vader's private ride, but it's in fact a souped-up version of the Porsche Panamera.

programme.title: Trackmasters
programme.desc: An angry bull, a few Englishmen who prepared themselves for rather unpleasant weather conditions and a young, talented race driver, these were all visitors who ventured to the infamous Green Hell of the Nürburgring.

programme.title: Trackmasters
programme.desc: A tuned-up Golf 2, a family sedan from Hanover, Germany and a very special Porsche GT2. We looked behind the scenes of the gas station by the curve on the race track where sports cars flock.

programme.title: Trackmasters
programme.desc: When the Nürburgring transforms into a winter wonderland, it may look pleasant but sure isn't too pleasant as a race track.

programme.title: Trackmasters
programme.desc: Fog, rain and snow means that a visit to the Eifel region isn't too pleasant. Nevertheless, the toughest drivers were at the track, not letting the weather get in their way.

programme.title: Jaguar XJR
programme.desc: The highlight of the XJR lies beneath the hood: all of Jaguar's top models are equipped with the 5-liter V8 compressor engine that delivers 550 HP in this sports sedan.

programme.title: Put your car on TV
programme.sub-title: Chevy Camaro vs Mercedes SLS AMG
programme.desc: Hosts Mylene Gomera and Saif Hattawi invite petrol heads from the Middle East to bring their tuned cars to the 'The Walk' at Jumeirah Beach and have it rated in the categories speed, style and sound. Whoever receives the most points, wins a one night stay for two people at this glamorous Sofitel Dubai Jumeirah Beach. On this episode, a Chevrolet Camaro and Mercedes SLS AMG try to impress.

programme.title: Put your car on TV
programme.desc: If you want to see out-of-this-world, customized or tuned luxury vehicles or posh cars you need to go to 'The Walk', the glamorous boulevard of Jumeirah Beach. Put Your Car on TV invites car owners to have their vehicles judged by Saif Hattawi. The person with the most points wins a special treat from the Sofitel Dubai Jumeirah Beach. Among the presented cars are a BMW X5 and a Mercedes SLK 230.

programme.title: Put your car on TV
programme.desc: People from the Middle East are crazy about their cars. On Put Your Car on TV they have the chance to present their tuned vehicles and judged. They are awarded points based on speed, style and sound and the car owner with the most points, wins a special treat for two from the Sofitel Dubai Jumeirah Beach. Among the competitors are a Nova SS, a special Honda Acord and a car full of crystals.

programme.title: Bentley Bentayga
programme.desc: With the Bentley Bentayga, the traditional British brand is entering the fastest growing market segment. This world's first luxury SUV is a conglomerate of superlatives on wheels.

programme.title: Mercedes Sprinter, 2018
programme.desc: The Mercedes Sprinter belongs to the class of commercial vehicles. The light transporter is the dream for every tradesman. The third generation Sprinter is sleeker, more modern and more variable than ever.

programme.title: Classic Ride
programme.desc: We present to you historic image and film documents from the Porsche 550 RS Spyder. And: how the Audi Quattro shocked its competitors with its driving dynamics.

programme.title: Classic Ride
programme.desc: French manufacturers have also built milestones in automotive history in the past, including lesser-known brands such as Delage and Talbot, but also vehicles from Peugeot, Renault and Citroen.

programme.title: Classic Ride
programme.desc: The Volkswagen Type 166 amphibious vehicle is the all-rounder amongst off-road vehicles. Also: the Peugeot 205 Turbo 16 all-wheeler turned the World Rally Championship in the 1980s on its head. And : the Willys Jeep in our drive report.

programme.title: Creme 21 Youngtimer Rally 2019
programme.desc: Welcome to the 80s, the period in time in which there were only three skin creams and three television programs on air and Tuesday night was Dallas night. - Car enthusiasts can feel like they’re back in those times once a year at the Creme 21 classic car rally.

programme.title: Lexus LS600h
programme.desc: Lexus is a pioneer in the construction of modern hybrid vehicles. In 2007 the Toyota brand's premium marque introduced the LS 600h with a combination of electric and combustion drive.

programme.title: Streetwise
programme.desc: Audi set new standards with their RS5 Coupe. Also: the Erzberg Rodeo is one of the toughest enduro races in the world. We show highlights from the 2012 event. And: the Suzuki Kizashi 4x4 and the Mercedes-Benz GL.

programme.title: Streetwise
programme.desc: The Ariel Atom is a street-legal sports car that provides ultimate acceleration and maximum cornering speed. Also: the third-generation Audi A3 on the roads of Mallorca. And: the Mini John Cooper Works Roadster and the fifth-generation Chevrolet Camaro.

programme.title: Streetwise
programme.desc: With the GT86, Toyota want to create a sports car that builds upon the glory days of the company's success model Celica. Also: Audi TT RS vs. Mercedes-AMG SLK 55. And: the Techart GT Street R, a souped-up Porsche 911 Turbo.
